intro: Selliguea aliena, commonly known as the rock tamarisk, is a species of liverwort found in arid and rocky environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form. The plant has a thalloid structure with a central stalk and leaf-like structures called phyllidia. It thrives in well-drained, sunny habitats and is often found on rock surfaces or in sandy soils. Selliguea aliena plays a role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments and is an indicator species for rocky, dry ecosystems.
